dt: {bc}to have or acquire the necessities of life (such as food and clothing)
{bc}to be logically conceivable as the subject of true statements

et: Late Latin {it}subsistere{/it} to exist, from Latin, to come to a halt, remain, from {it}sub-{/it} + {it}sistere{/it} to come to a stand; akin to Latin {it}stare{/it} to stand {ma}{mat|stand|}{/ma}
shortdef: to have or acquire the necessities of life (such as food and clothing); especially : to nourish oneself

dt: {bc}to use (something) as a way to stay alive {bc}to live on (something)

dt.t: poor people {it}subsisting on{/it} just one or two dollars a day
The villagers {it}subsist{/it} almost entirely {it}on{/it} rice and fish.

shortdef: to use (something) as a way to stay alive : to live on (something)
